intro: Hieracium atroadenium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and often have a rough texture, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat head. Hieracium atroadenium is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions, making it a common sight in many temperate regions.
